episodes.title: LIVE: Russia Jails "Siberian Jesus" for 12 Years for Harming Followers in Bizarre Cult
episodes.description:
A Russian cult leader who claimed to be the reincarnation of Jesus Christ has been sentenced to 12 years in a maximum-security prison. Sergei Torop, known to followers as "Vissarion," founded the Church of the Last Testament in Siberia in 1991 and attracted thousands to his remote commune. Russian authorities say Torop and two aides used psychological manipulation to control followers, causing serious mental and physical harm and defrauding them of money. The court also ordered over $570,000 in compensation to victims. The trio was arrested in a dramatic 2020 raid by Russian security forces. All three denied wrongdoing.

----

episodes.title: Shakahola Massacre: Kenya Cult Leader Paul Mackenzie Pleads Not Guilty for Manslaughter
episodes.description:
Shakahola Massacre: Kenya Cult Leader Paul Mackenzie Pleads Not Guilty for Manslaughter | Firstpost Africa

The hearing resumes in one of the worst cult-related tragedies in the world. Leader of a Kenyan cult, Paul Mackenzie, who allegedly pushed over 400 people to starve to death pleads not guilty in court. Self-proclaimed pastor Paul Mackenzie appeared in court in the coastal city of Mombasa alongside 94 other suspects. Mackenzie was arrested last April after 429 bodies, including children, were dug up from mass graves in Shakahola, a remote forest in eastern Kenya. Mackenzie allegedly told his followers they would get to heaven more quickly if they stopped eating. the incident sent shockwaves in the country and across the world. Watch for more.

---

episodes.title: LIVE: Kenya's "Doomsday Cult" Leader Goes on Trial | Firstpost Africa
episodes.description:
LIVE: Kenya's "Doomsday Cult" Leader Goes on Trial | Firstpost Africa

Welcome to Firstpost Africa with Alyson Le Grange. We are live from Durban, South Africa.

A self-proclaimed pastor Paul Nthenge Mackenzie and almost 100 accomplices have gone on trial in Kenya on terrorism charges over the notorious "Shakahola forest massacre." The case follows the exhumation of more than 400 corpses. Mackenzie, who was arrested in April last year, is alleged to have incited his followers to starve to death to “meet Jesus”. Autopsies carried out on 100 victims determined that the majority had died of starvation, but that some, including children, had been strangled, beaten, or suffocated. Mackenzie and his co-accused all pleaded not guilty to the charges.

Also on the show:
- DR Congo Military Court Sentences 22 Soldiers to Death For "Fleeing the Enemy"
- Ghanaian Chef Ebenezer Smith Fakes Guinness World Records Award, Arrested
- Nigerians Reclaim Their Mangroves Back

---

episodes.title: Kenya Hands Over Bodies of 429 Cult Members, its Head Paul Mackenzie Awaits Trial |Firstpost America
episodes.description:
Kenya Hands Over Bodies of 429 Cult Members, its Head Paul Mackenzie Awaits Trial | Firstpost America

The Kenyan government has begun handing over the remains of the people who were found dead in the Shakahola forest. These people were members of the cult led by Paul Mackenzie and his wife. He convinced these people to starve themselves and their children to death to meet Jesus. The bodies of these people were unearthed by the police who were buried together in groups in mass graves. Some bodies even had internal organs missing. The police arrested Mackenzie in 2023 and charged him with manslaughter, terrorism, and murder. He is currently serving a yearlong jail sentence for illegally running a studio.

---
